page.title: 04COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES
page.content: In the past Rookhope Village Hall has seen a carpet bowls club, a Guide company, a judo club, bingo evenings, a playgroup and concert parties. At one time it even doubled as a schoolroom. Regular activities these days include a youth club, badminton, Brownies, ladies' keep fit and a Women's Institute. More occasional uses such as the collection of rates and dispensing of bus tokens to the senior citizens, a baby clinic and a chiropodist take place. Different groups of people hire the hall for sales of work, wedding receptions, discos and twenty-first birthday parties. Travelling pantomimes and artificial ice rinks are also part of the village hall's programme.
